summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence primarily between defense attorney Joe Nascimento and federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding a cooperating client in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss scheduling meetings, confirming the client's cooperative status, and logistical planning for proffer sessions in Florida, spanning from July 2019 to March 2021.

persons.name: Joe Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney representing a cooperating client in the Epstein investigation. He communicates with SDNY prosecutors to schedule meetings, provide updates on his client's availability, and confirm her continued cooperation.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Deceased former law partner of Joe Nascimento who previously represented the cooperating client. His passing in 2018 led Nascimento to take over as the inventory attorney.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of her arrest in July 2020, which prompted Nascimento to check in with prosecutors regarding his client's status.

connections.description: Former law partners. Nascimento took over representation of a client after Ross's death in 2018.
Nascimento's client is a cooperating witness in the investigation involving Ghislaine Maxwell, as indicated by his check-in after Maxwell's arrest.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Arrest Reported
events.description: Joe Nascimento emails prosecutors after seeing reports of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest, checking in on his client's status.

events.title: Meeting at Hilton West Palm Beach
events.description: A scheduled meeting between Joe Nascimento, his client, and SDNY prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Meeting
events.description: Prosecutors propose a proffer meeting with Nascimento's client on September 4th, later rescheduled due to a storm.

events.title: Death of Alan Ross
events.description: Alan Ross, former law partner of Joe Nascimento, passes away. Nascimento becomes the inventory attorney for Ross's former client.

locations: Hilton in West Palm Beach, 600 Okeechobee Blvd
keyFacts: Joe Nascimento represents a cooperating female client in the SDNY's Epstein investigation, and her status as a cooperative witness remained unchanged from the prosecution's perspective throughout the correspondence.
The emails reveal detailed logistical planning for proffer sessions and meetings in Florida, including concerns about hurricane disruptions in August/September 2019.
Nascimento's involvement began after the death of his former partner, Alan Ross, who had previously represented the client.
The correspondence shows ongoing, cooperative communication between the defense and prosecution from mid-2019 into early 2021.
A key point of contact was the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in July 2020, which prompted Nascimento to check on his client's standing with prosecutors.
